title: Ticket #3166: FileLock::initLockFile modes
description:
From Florian Weimer -

FileLock::initLockFile() in src/condor_utils/file_lock.cpp invokes rec_touch_file() with mode 0777. Here's an example from condor_schedd during job submission: 

[pid 21383] mkdir("/var", 0777)         = -1 EEXIST (File exists)
[pid 21383] mkdir("/var/lock", 0777)    = -1 EEXIST (File exists)
[pid 21383] mkdir("/var/lock/condor", 0777) = -1 EEXIST (File exists)
[pid 21383] mkdir("/var/lock/condor/local", 0777) = -1 EEXIST (File exists)
[pid 21383] mkdir("/var/lock/condor/local//89", 0777) = 0
[pid 21383] mkdir("/var/lock/condor/local//89/31", 0777) = 0

These syscalls happen with effective user ID of the job owner. A local attacker can rename the directory /var/lock/condor/local/89/31 to /tmp and complete an FS-based authentication challenge as the job owner.
remarks:
2012-Jul-30 15:26:20 by matt:
It looks like the FS auth code should validate the directory is mode=0700. The lock file directories are necessarily mode!=0700.

2012-Jul-30 16:02:31 by matt:
Client side use of mkdir(...,0700) appeared in 6f723047 (~V6_8_1).

2012-Jul-30 17:30:50 by matt:
Recommendation - remove FS_ALLOW_UNSAFE, it was introduced in ~6.8.1 for compatibility

2012-Jul-31 15:15:38 by zmiller:
CODE REVIEW by zmiller

patch looks good. i also verified by hand that this would in fact be a problem, and that changing the permissions check solves the problem.
